p: Significantly immunosuppressed travelers can be provided with an emergency pack of antibiotics for self-treatment of TD while abroad. They should also be encouraged to pack some oral rehydration therapy sachets, which can be easily purchased in most pharmacies and prepared with bottled water. TheseÂ are particularly advisable for travelers at increased risk of complications from dehydration [ 65]. Prophylactic antibiotics may be considered for significantly immunosuppressed travelers, especially for short-term travel to high-risk countries; however, the risk of drug interactions and side effects should be considered [ 14].
